result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J Miller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 9:50 am case called. Defendant Matthew J Miller in court with attorney Ethan E Vollmer.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated by ADA Anderson. Attorney Vollmer concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2. No statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 7 months WCJ, STAYED and places on probation for a period of 1 year. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time credit. 1 day credit for time served. CONDITIONS:   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. AODA and follow through. DNA Sample & surcharge. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD:  Attorney Ethan E Vollmer in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Vollmer requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 09:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew J Miller
Current: 5913 Sugarbush Ln, Greendale, WI 53129-2624 United States  (Effective: 09-17-2015)
Prior: 1625 Elmwood Ave; #201, Oshkosh, WI 54901

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ethan E Vollmer in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Update by Attorney Vollmer regarding status of the defendant.  Status conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 02:10 pm.
Atty Vollmer's copy returned by USPS - Re-mailed to attorney
Attorney's NOH returned by USPS - Re-mailed to Attorney Vollmer
from Atty Vollmer requesting a plea/sentencing hearing

Case Called @ 11:18 AM: Defendant Matthew J Miller in court with attorney Ethan E Vollmer.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  STC Scheduled - NOH given.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 10:15 am.
The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:09 p.m. Defendant Matthew J Miller in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will not be represented by SPD if released from custody. ADA Anderson requesting $1000 Sig Bond. Atty Szilagyi takes no position as to bond. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 11:30 am.
